Reviews.Title: “Nice central place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: Kitty1965_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend when we attended a concert nearby in the Palais de Omnisports. Good central location, nice entrance and foyer to hotel. Staff pleasant. Corridors leading to rooms were very narrow and made you feel a bit claustrophobic. Room was nice, with french doors that were good to open during the night when it was very warm in the room. Sadly not a particularly nice view from them, but it didn't matter that much really as we didn't spend that much time in the room. Breakfast was ample and a good choice of food. Very clean also. Surrounded by nice places to eat/drink. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Kandeee
Reviews.Content: We have visited this hotel with a big bunch of friends ( 15 people) for a long weekend mid of March. We were really satisfied with the hotel. As we were so many persons, we could see several types of rooms, the double, the triple and the quadrouple, and found all of them comfortable and clean. The only small inconvenience was, that the street in front of the hotel is very noisy also during the night, you have to close the windows tightly for the night to sleep well. The hotel offered a simple but nice breakfast with fresh bakeries. The location of the hotel is ideal, you can stroll along the Seine to reach Notre Dame in 20 minutes or take the metro at Gare de Lyon which is in front of the hotel to anywhere in Paris, including the surroundings. ( The RER to Disneyland starts from Gare de Lyon) . We enjoyed our stay very much, and I will definitely recommend the hotel to anybody traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A bit on expensive side but good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliettewerr
Reviews.Content: I arrived late and couldn’t find the hotel so I had to call reception twice to ask for directions. They were helpful and courteous. My room was on the 5ht floor and didn’t have much of the view, but was cosy, clean and tastefully decorated. It was exceptionally cold in Paris that night and having a lovely warm room to rest it felt very pleasant. My bed was comfy too with a lovely soft, long pillow. Shower was compact but powerful and sparkling white. TV had a small range of channels in English, two of which were news channels. In the morning breakfast was rather good with some croissants (plain or chocolate), ham, cheese, hard boiled eggs and some fruit. Coffee was served in medium sized coffee pots and tasted delicious. The staff were friendly and helpful at every point and were able to advice on various travel points. Having an internet centre was a bonus, as for once I didn’t have my laptop. Overall, it was a bit pricy but lovely hotel in a good location – right across Gare De Lyon train station and close to a number of interesting historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: dclark895
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights in June 2011. Our travels brought us to arrive very late but a gentleman waited on us at the front desk and even helped with directions to the hotel via phone when we got lost. Everyone at this hotel provides excellent service! The breakfast provided was great and my children really enjoyed the Nutella spread for the great croissants. When it was almost time for breakfast to be finished my wife was still upstairs. I asked if I could take her up some coffee and a wonderful gentlemen said, "I will take a tray up to the room" Wow! Also, I accidently left out on the bathroom counter in our room a considerable amount of money in a money pouch. I worried all day while we were at Versaille that the money would be gone but it was nicely put below a towel in the bathroom. No money was gone! My wife loved this hotel and we would definitely stay there again when we get to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “So handy for the station”
Reviews.Author: caroleburrows9
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel on two occasions as it's so handy for the Gare de Lyon station, literally just across the road, when you have an early train from there. The first time the Receptionist was a little off hand, the second time another Receptionist was much more welcoming. The hotel is geared to the traveller with early breakfasts - a real help. Rooms usual French slightly small, but comfortable enough. Handy for plenty of cafes and restaurants. We'll probably stay again next year when we go south.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: GloriaJC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across from the Gare de Lyon train station and provides easy access to trains, the metro, city buses, the RER. the L'Open hop on / hop off bus, and the the Air France bus to Charles de Gaulle airport. There are plenty of excellent restaurants nearby including Le Dindon En Laisse, Les Rustres, and Vesuvio. We arrived in Paris at the Gare de Montparnasse station and took the #91 bus across town to Gare de Lyon. We also suggest taking bus #87 from the train station to the Eiffel Tower and Bus 63 and 69 to see various sites. The metro is also a good way to get around, but I enjoy taking a bus so I can enjoy the city sites in route. There was also a bus from Gare de Lyon to the Gare d'Est station for a day trip to Reims. The room may lack romantic French charm, but was clean and comfortable. We stayed in a room with a balcony overlooking the train station and were not bothered by the street noise. The staff at the hotel are extremely welcoming and always helpful. The room price was reasonable and included a buffet breakfast. When I return to Paris, I will definitely stay here again because of the staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Transportation Links!”
Reviews.Author: Dickens052
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights. I chose this hotel due to positive reviews and excellent transportation links. It is worth checking the hotel website as I found a better deal on it than travel sites which included breakfast. Front desk personnel were really friendly and helpful. Our check in was a breeze. We were greeted right away as the hotel was expecting our arrival around a certain time. I didn't even have to sign in. Logis Terminus is very European in nature. It is a smaller hotel. Our room was a bit small but was fine for 2 with a desk and a couple chairs. It was very clean, well kept and updated. The elevator was small and barely had room for 2 with suitcases which added to the character. Breakfast was very good. We were served a basket of fresh delicious croissants and breads with little jars of jam and choice of tea or coffee. There was a small buffet which had good quality ham, cheese, yogurt, fruit and juice. We used the metro, Gare de Lyon, which is basically across the street to get around the city. It is really easy and efficient. The Gare de Lyon also has many trains. L' Open tour (hop on/off tour bus) is just around the corner on Lyon. The hotel gave us a voucher coupon for a 2 day pass which costs the same as a one day. We used this to see all the main tourist sights. (The orange line wasn't operation but this was no big deal.) We also caught the train out to Versailles from Gare d' Austerlitz which is an easy 10 minute walk. I would really recommend seeing the Chateau Versailles. It is amazing! We also took the metro one evening to see the Eiffel tower. This was again spectacular to see at night. The Parc Zoologique is an easy 10 minute walk as well. It is a really nice area to walk around and enjoy the outdoors. There are also several restaurants, pharmacies and a couple grocery stores very close by to purchase bottled water, fruit, wine, etc. The hotel emailed us directions from the airport when arriving by using the train from CDG. It was quite easy. Upon returning to CDG we took the Air France bus which was only a block away and much quicker. I would recommend using this service both ways even though it is more expensive. We had no complaints with the hotel. I would really recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good place to stay with great transportation links. However please note that this area doesn't have the tourist shops/ restaurants like the Montmartre area.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: ice_queen570
Reviews.Content: A comfortable, if petite, hotel that provided Exactly for our single night Parisian stop-off. We reserved a family room, travelling as 4 adults, and although the room didn't want to be any smaller, it was comfortable and the unexpected station-view balcony was a welcome treat. The first to breakfast, at a wincingly early 5.35am, we were greeted with a genuine "bonjour!" and the closest you'll get to an English cup of tea. All round, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bit noisy, if you have a room in the front”
Reviews.Author: aa27
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, reasonable continental breakfast plus a small buffet, confortable beds and perfect bathroom. Right in front of gare de Lyon, so very convenient when arriving by train, and for going anywhere in Paris by metro. Notre Dame is actually reachable walking along the Seine in 20-30 minutes of nice promenade. Only problem the noise, since we had a room in the front, just over a bus stop: it could disturb the sleep expecially in the early morning, depending on your sensitivity.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very helpful friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Catnap99
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, comfortable room and friendly staff. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not exellent”
Reviews.Author: Igor I
Reviews.Content: We were in this hotel during weekend in September 2011. We could find in this hotel not reach but very good breakfast, clean room with daily cleaning and very sympathetic staff. Room was small but comfortable with very small bathroom and toilet in one. Mini bar with different beverages was there. In this hotel we could see the smallest elevator in the world. It was fun. Near the hotel we found very good restaurant (next door) without any preliminary reservation procedure. It was nice to have very good dinner there with two steps from our hotel entrance. I will definitely stay in this hotel again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire155
Reviews.Content: We arrived on theTGV from Perpignan at 10.45pm so wanted a hotel close to the Gare de Lyon. This hotel is just across the road so no jostling for a taxi or a tiring walk. We were greeted by a pleasant receptionist and our room, on the fourth floor, was just right for an overnight stay. We had a twin double room for 3 of us in one of the odd-shaped corner rooms. Everything was immaculate with stylish fixtures & fittings. Would have been a bit cramped if there were four of us or we wanted to stay longer (but then if we did, we would have chosen a more central hotel) but it suited us just fine. Though the other rooms may be more spacious. Breakfast was served in a very sweet little room with a decorated glass ceiling. All the staff we came across were pleasant though apparently with little English (though probably better than my French!). We recommend it for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Stay - Still Excellent For My Needs”
Reviews.Author: Alec
Reviews.Content: I first picked this hotel because of its convenience to Gare de Lyon, the station at which I was arriving by train, and the hotel is across the street. I have gone back for the same reason andf for others. Although the rooms have been somewhat small in typical European fashion, they have enough space in which to move and place things, it is clean, the beds are comfortable, and the bathroom is good enough, The staff are always friendly and helpful, and the includes the chamber maids. Breakfast (included in room rate) is typical continental with some cold cereals, cheese, meat, yogurt, coffee or tea, croissants, rolls, etc. That it opens at 5:30 a.m. is an added plus since I had to catch an early plane. The room rate was reasonalbe for this type of hotel and for this city. There is a computer with free internet access right off the eating area. The location is excellent. The train station also has Metro (subway) and RER (underground suburban) trains that make moving around the city easy. Also, a number of bus lines in the area will take one to different parts of the city too. There are a good number of restaurants in the area. good bakerie and some shops and stores. A straight walk on the Rue de Lyon will take one into the active Bastille area with lots of restaurants and the Opera House. The Air France shuttle to and from CDG airport stops not far from the hotel, so that offers an added conventience. This hotel and its location met all my needs. When I return to Paris (how can one not want to go back?) I will definitely stay at thhis hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great breakfast and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: peteukmcr
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 20:30 on the 12th May after a train journey from Manchester, UK via London and Eurostar to Paris Nord. Check in was fast and efficient by a very friendly gentleman. We were in room 'B' on the 2nd floor. The room had two double beds and large bathroom that was scrupulously clean with a good size walk in shower. Quite a strange shaped room, but I think that gave extra space with a window overlooking the internal courtyard. A safe was available at no extra charge in the closet as was WiFi in the room after getting a code from the front desk. If you have more than 1 PC/iPad etc you will need 2 codes as you can only have 1 connection at any one time. We went for a pizza and a few drinks to the Pizzeria (Pizza Vesuvio) next door that was great value. As we were catching a 7:20 am train from Gare de Lyon the next day, the location of this hotel is ideal and the fact that breakfast is served from 5:30 am. Breakfast consists of fresh juices, cereals and the normal continental choices. The staff bring you your choice of tea or coffee together with a fresh bread basket containing pain au chocolate and crossiants, really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, excellent location, comfortable and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: O'Hearn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because; 1) The Trip Adviser reviews were excellent. 2) It was close to Gare de Lyon from which we had an early departure and which also has a Metro station for quick access to other parts of Paris. 3) The Les Cars Line 4 from CDG dropped off 40 metres away on our inward bound. We were not disappointed in our choice. The staff in this hotel from the front desk to the cleaners could not be more pleasant and helpful. We stayed in a family room on the second floor at the front of the hotel for three nights in early April after having inadvertently booked a smoking room which was at the back of the hotel - my fault, not the hotel's. We changed this room with a minimum of fuss and a maximum amount of assistance from the staff. In the room there was a desk, wardrobe, drawers, sofa, double glass doors that opened to the outside and a good sized bathroom. I would recommend this type of room even for a couple. It won't break the bank and you will have plenty of room to spread out your stuff or even unpack if you have enough time. There was an interesting view of the street life and it wasn't too noisy at all. I am a light sleeper and wasn't woken at any time. The free wi-fi was a bonus and we had no connection problems. Breakfast was good and there is a wide choice of restaurants and bars in the area. All up, a great hotel for a short stop-over and we will be back next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and a friendly smile”
Reviews.Author: Obi2Kenobi
Reviews.Content: stuck in paris over night, i was lucky to walk into this hotel and get the last room. The room its self was a bit small but more than adequate for me on my own and also felt a little old fashioned. The bathroom however was very big and modern. The night porter who checked me in was very friendly and helpful with a recommendation for a late diner and a wake up call. When checking out it was the safe friendly smile and attention as at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Terminus Lyon”
Reviews.Author: gawab
Reviews.Content: Convenient transport links from the hotel. Good restaurants are nearby. Lift was not working during a stop in the hotel, had to climb to 4 (about Russian standards) floor. Staff wonderful and is very friendly. The hotel a very clean and comfortable. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “5-star service - it cannot be better than that”
Reviews.Author: GABA54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located (opposite gare de Lyon) and rooms are simple but nice, clean and spacious. What makes this hotel a pure gem is the quality of service, which is so rare to find in Paris. From the manager to the cleaning lady, the whole staff is genuinely nice and smiling and will go the extra mile to make sure you feel happy and relaxed. When our children were crying during breakfast, they offered them some small toys to keep them contented. This is a 3-star hotel with 5-star service.

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Clean; Very near Gare de Lyon.”
Reviews.Author: OzSooty
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night as we wanted to be close to Gare de Lyon, and it is literally just across the street. We had a room at the back and its was very quiet. The room itself had Air Con, cupboard, desk, phone, mini-bar, safe, bath/shower and the bed was 6foot 2in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, clean and worthwhile the money”
Reviews.Author: LunaDew
Reviews.Content: Their location is so convenient; just across from the metro. The room was small but super clean and comfortable. They have breakfast included and it was really good; fresh fruit, croissants, cheeses, ham, cereal and the staff is very helpful. The nights are quiet and they have a great restaurant called European within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Rubi5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in two separate rooms on two separate occasions on this trip. We previously stayed here about 4 years ago and there are improvements in the rooms. The bathrooms have been updated and the beds seem more comfortable. Front desk people remain helpful. The hotel is across the street from Gare de Lyon and also across the street from the drop off point of Air France Shuttle from CDG.l One night a neighboring room was noisy and the front desk immediately took care of the situation. Storage in the room and bathroom is minimal.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely worth going, will come back if back to Paris”
Reviews.Author: blendstock
Reviews.Content: the location is absolutely wonderful, it is so easy to go in the city making use of the Gare de Lyon station, and to and from the airport. I stayed in a single room, it is not big, but really clean and well maintained, especially the bathroom. the room is not on the street side and is very quiet. breakfast is very basic, you can get sth to fill up your stomach however. the front desk is very friendly and helpful, they are very polite. free wifi internet, works very well. basin and shower tub sink well. they provide soap and bath jell. clean towels. absolutely fine in the bath room. nearby restaurants are nice, the price is not low of course. the less nice things are: they use blanket with a sheet to cover you, which i don't like. i prefer quilt. blanket let you feel unclean and you don't want to touch it. the isolation of sounds is not good, you hear next room's sound very clearly. you can easily hear what they say. but not all people speak that loud anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in Paris”
Reviews.Author: janne889
Reviews.Content: Clearly above average for a Parisian small hotel. Has air con and elevator, which you don't typically find in such hotels. Breakfast was OK. Location is bit away from the very centre but there's good metro and bus connections. We continued from Gare de Lyon in the morning, for this the hotel is perfect as it's right across the street from the station. Free Wi-Fi is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: SpannerPerthWA
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for where it was not what it was and therefore got what I expected. A good location for Paris within a good walk of Notre Dame and easy access to the Metro for exploration by metro at a ‘reasonable’ price. Some restaurants close at hand but the prices for what you get are not to hot. The room was small but not tiny. Breakfast was good. The only problem was the wireless internet, it worked infrequently.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Value!”
Reviews.Author: bkkandtwk
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at this hotel. The location is right across the street from Gare de Lyon metro station making getting around Paris extremely simple - yet the rooms are amazingly quiet! The staff members are friendly and more than willing to be helpful. We were very pleased with the breakfast each morning and there are an abundance of wonderful restaurants within walking distance. It is our pleasure to give this hotel an outstanding review!

Reviews.Title: “Location was great”
Reviews.Author: CSBBozeman_MT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a 2-day trip to Paris and chose it because of it's closeness to the train station. We were not disappointed. It was easy to find and a quick 2-minute walk from the station. It was also central for our catching the hop-on, hop-off bus and there were many restaurants to choose from in close proximity. The staff spoke good English and we were able to understand each other, well. This is an older, hotel - narrow hallways, small elevator, but was charming and so convenient. Good buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fair service for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: G9508
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, close to a central metro and RER station. Friendly staff, reasonable breakfast. Room and bathroom OK. We were a bit concerned with the near-by railstation, but it was safe and clean all around. The only bad experience - the bed mattresses that were awful.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ysouk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice during my recent trip. The price of this hotel was good and is right beside Gare De Lyon which I used to travel to Geneva and Nice. My first stay was good, while the room was small, the room was at a higher floor and quiet. The breakfast was the same everyday but it was the typical fare you get at most 3* hotels. However, on my second stay, while I paid much more for the room, I did not enjoy my stay even though I got a bigger room.The room was facing the main road and it was very noisy. The wall was thin and the family staying beside my room was noisy too and woke me up a few time. The lift is very small which can only accommodate 2 persons at a times. If you just need a room to stay over and is not light sleeper, you can consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody got bug bites, disappointed otherwise too”
Reviews.Author: Perttu007
Reviews.Content: Well the hotel was allright the first night, but the second night the air conditioning broke and they didn't got it fixed. It was 28 degrees celsius through the night eve though they brought us an old broken fan. Then in the morning the hotel manager said he offers us breakfasts for free. I said it wasnt all right and I managed to get 50 e off of the room price and they didnt charge us of the first breakfast. The second we enjoyed elsewhere. AND when we got home, everybody had itching bug bites (dont which bug). So were not going back. And I dont think you should either.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient hotel, with excellent and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: mcowan32
Reviews.Content: There could hardly be a better location for anyone travelling out of Paris from the Gare de Lyon, especially early in the day. Top (5th) floor rooms have a small balcony with superb views over the station forecourt with its spectacular clock. Staff on reception and breakfast were very helpful and patient, even with my limited French language skills! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, just noisy”
Reviews.Author: tacalderon
Reviews.Content: There were four of us and our room was small but what I expected for a popular European city. The bad thing was that the hotel is located on a busy street so there was noise all night long. We could even here a person cough while walking on the street downstairs. The staff was accomodating and the free breakfast was good. The good thing was that we were right near a Metro stop so we could reach anywhere in the city easily by train. There may have been better places to stay but the value here was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: xgeorgeAthens
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a similarly priced hotel less than two years ago, I am very happy that this time I followed the Trip Advisor collective wisdom and chose the Terminus Lyon instead. Regarding location, Paris has so many sights, that you cannot reasonably expect to be close to more than a handful, so you will take the metro wherever you stay. This hotel is across the street from the Gare de Lyon rail (SNCF)/suburban rail (RER)/metro station, so you can get to CDG airport with one RER change. Metro line 1 will take you to the Louvre, Opera Bastille, the Grand Palais and L'etoile, it is very frequent and very fast, and it crosses most other lines. And the area around the station is actually quite nice, with restaurants and bars that stay open late. Regarding the hotel itself, the room I got was very nice and in excellent condition (and spotless), there was a lift (small, but always working), the breakfast was of good quality, even though limited, and served in a small lobby (and was included in the price, unlike many other Paris hotels that will charge you 10+ EUR per person). Finally, you get free wireless Internet access in the rooms. I could not have asked for more from a budget hotel, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “"Gary Lyon"”
Reviews.Author: VicM
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and had a very pleasant stay ayt this hotel. The hotel is located opposite the Gare de Lyon train station/metro station, surrounded by restaurants. There is a supermarket nearby - go out front door of hotel, turn left and turn left at the first street you come to, the supermarket is 2 minutes walk on the right hand side of the street. You will need to catch the metro to get to the sites from the hotel, but this would be similar at other hotels. the hotel room is a good size and is clean, neat and tidy with a good bathrooom. Reception is very good and helpfull. Breakfast is quite adequate (no hot stuff). Hotel price was very reasonable for paris (check bookings.com). If we return to Paris we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great transit hotel option”
Reviews.Author: YMLSydney
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its convenience to both Gare de Lyon (from where we had to catch a train early in the morning) and Austerlitz (where we arrived by train from southern France). It was a comfortable walk from Austerlitz, even with suitcases (on wheels) and is opposite Gare de Lyon. The hotel is very clean and staff were friendly - allowing us to check in earlier than official check in time. The room and bathroom are tiny but clean and adequate for one night. The plastic undersheet on the bed made the night a little bit sweaty but there were no problems with noise or anything else. Check out the lovely Moroccan restaurant around the corner - I left some of their cards at the concierge!

Reviews.Title: “good location, basic, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rubi5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It is located almost directly across the street from Gare Lyon. It is safe, clean and most of the concierge staff is knowledgeable. The room itself is similar to a motel 6-a double bed and a tiny bathroom but it is clean and safe. Bao, the concierge, gave us good information but some of the other staff seemed not to be able to recommend restaurants or provide transportation advice. Only two slim people and two moderate size pieces of luggage can fit into the lift at the same time. The breakfast room is comfortable and the hostess serves coffee, tea and bread and the rest is self serve: boiled eggs, cereal, canned fruit and yogurt. We asked for a quiet room and we were given the top floor corner room which was probably the most quiet in the building. There is a central courtyard, (using the term loosely) that has mechanical equipment in it and is not accessible. We used the Air France shuttle from CDG and it was very convenient to the hotel. We walked from the hotel to the Louvre but it was quite a distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in a Traditional Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: worker_bea
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived earlier than usual, and our shuttle was on time we arrived an hour before checkin but the very polite and friendly man at the desk found us a room, which opened onto a pleasant air shaft and was very quiet. There are narrow halls, and old lift and a spiral staircase. This is obviously an older building that has been renovated and well maintained to offer the guest a feeling of old Paris. It is clean, and the room was larger than some we have encountered in Paris. We had wireless access in our room, but could not send e-mail. The bathroom is small, but has a powerful shower and a good hairdryer. The bedroom furniture is above average for a hotel and the decor is pleasant but basic. I recommend the Terminus cafe next door, but there are several other eating places nearby and the hotel is with a few blocks walk of several well-known restaurants. We stayed here for one night because it was close to Gare de Lyon. We will return here for a pleasant place that is clean and no-frills.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baileymist
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Our price included breakfast which was a buffet and there was plenty of food to set you up for the day. They also brought tea/coffee or hot chocolate to the table with croissants and a roll each morning. Our room had air conditioning which we really needed as the weather was lovely and warm. Apart from the bed there were two chairs and a writing desk in the room which was great. We also had a small balcony which overlooked a busy junction and I enjoyed watching the hustle and bustle outside but when we closed the window it kept out all the noise. The bathroom was small but had a great shower. Towels were replaced every day and soap/shower gels as necessary. This was all done by a really pleasant young girl who also made the bed and tidied the room for us. The hotel is close to a supermarket, a bakery, a pharmacy, post office, an ATM machine, lots of restaurants, the metro, a hop on hop off bus stop, 2/3 locations where you can hire a Velib bike. Internet access was free. The lift was small but efficient. We got the Air France bus to and from the airport and it was a great service. It stopped a very short walk from the hotel. We really enjoyed our stay and while this hotel would not be considered central we were able to visit all the sights without any difficulty. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super - Value, Clean, Location, its a gem.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheWorld247
Reviews.Content: Did long search on web and found this gem. Booked online via Venere.com and asked back yard view. It was perfect on 4th floor, we could sleep with open window - so quite. Elevator very small for 3 people but we never used as only 5 floors. Renovated washroom, small rooms just to get in, sleep, and get out to enjoy included breakfast and to the city. Next to hotel few brasseries open very late so after whole day if still hungry just stop by and try seafood fondu. Will definatelly stay again next time, hope price would be the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: MaxOslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, a group of children, youngsters, parents and a gay couple. For a double room booked through Venere we paid 118€ incl. breakfast. A very nice hotel. It's location close to Gare de Lyon gives easy access to all of Paris. Short walk to Bastillearea with several good restaurants. Nice, decent breakfast and very serviceminded staff. The rooms were more spacious and better than it seemed from the hotelsite's photos. Tiled bathrooms. Everything was clean and proper. We were very satisfied and will stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: YXEinWAW
Reviews.Content: Four family members and I stayed at this hotel for three nights and what impressed us from the moment we arrived was the kindness, friendliness and overall helpfulness of the staff. My mom has some special needs and everything was done to make her time as easy as possible. The rooms themselves, though basic, were clean and spacious. Breakfast was filling and gave us a good start to each day. We were also happy with the location: the metro was close, the Open Tour bus (hop on/hop off) was right around the corner and many restaurants were in the area. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edie1966
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of previous tripadvsor reviews and was not disappointed. I've rated it excelent as although it isn't the Ritz, it exceeded expectations and was excellent value for money given its location. It's conveniently situated across the road from la Gare du Lyon (from which station trains run directly to Disneyland Paris where we were going next) and is within fairly easy walking distance of the Omnisports arena, Bercy (where we were seeing KISS). It's also just a short walk across the Seine to the Batobus stop. In all, ideal for our purposes. The rooms are small, but our two double bedded room was fine for the two of us and our 17 year old son - we only needed a place to sleep and shower. The room was nicely decorated, the beds comfortable with extra pillows and blankets in the wardrobe, and the bathroom well presented with an excellent shower. Our room looked onto the central courtyard so we were undisturbed by passing revellers! Indeed, the corridors are small and poky, and the lift is most certainly tiny - but this made absolutely no difference to the pleasantness of our stay. There is no kettle, but should you wish to bring your own there is a small minibar fridge which would have had room for a pint of milk. The breakfast is basic but plentiful and of good quality - bread, croissants and pain au chocolat, cereals, ham, cheese and hard boiled eggs, with orange juice and a choice of tea or coffee, both served in a pot. The staff were friendly - a smile and a "bonjour" from everyone including the maids, and the reception staff spoke good English. The servers at breakfast didn't speak much English at all so you may need to brush up on a little basic French (or rely on your fellow guests to translate for you) but this is no reason at all not to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good price.Great location”
Reviews.Author: brownbear250
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in May.Chose it for it's location close to the Gare de Lyon and it couldn't have been handier.Right across the road.The room was clean,a bit cramped but perfectly ok.The breakfast was very good and the staff friendly.We got a taxi from Gare du Nord which cost 11 euros.Would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be close to the station at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mattnfaye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and we thought it was fantastic. From the moment we got there till the moment we left we were more than happy with everything Terminus Lyon had to offer. Our room was great, very clean and tidy. We had a balcony with a great view. The photos of the room don't do it justice, as they look a lot better when you're actually there. The breakfast was delicious and very filling. The best thing about staying at this hotel was the amazing and friendly service. All the staff would go out of their way to help you, especially the lovely, young lady on the front desk. Anyway i think you have got the point that this place is wonderful. When we go back to Paris we will be staying here, so i would definately recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, but bad beds”
Reviews.Author: jddphd
Reviews.Content: Directly across the street from the Gare de Lyon, there's no denying the convenience of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and pleasant. In fact, I had a bit of an emergency and need to have my trousers pressed and they did it well and quickly, with a smile on their faces. The only downside (and it is a deal-breaker for me) is that the bed and bedding were miserable. The pillows had a plastic coating and the thin pillowcase wasn't enough. And with no mattress pad, the thin sheet on the mattress was uncomfortable and frankly kind of gross and sticky since the room was a little warm. Shame, really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mozart_fan
Reviews.Content: We booked through Venere.com for a Quad room for our family of 2 adults and 2 kids. The reception ladies were polite and accomodating. Our room was decent for the price we got; they are air-conditioned with double-paned windows so, even if your room is street-side, you won't hear traffic noise. The bathroom is nice but provided with funky pull-out-sheet-by-sheet toilet paper! There is a small elevator for those who don't travel light. The best feature of this hotel is its location -- it was most convenient to be just diagnoally across the street from the Metro and train station (however, many exits lead out of this vast station so be on the alert which one will lead you to the hotel or you could be wandering around inside the station quite lost!). The breakfast provided by the hotel was decent for France, albeit meagre by German standards. There are brasseries, cafes and hole-in-the-walls everywhere around you so it's not likely that you would go hungry. Pharmacy and ATM also nearby. A steal in Paris, especially given the pathetic dollar-Euro exchange rate these days. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Conorooney
Reviews.Content: We booked this on bookings.com for 2 people for 3 nights and all it cost was €315. We had our reservations but a few reviews on this proved helpful in chosing and they were right. A wonderful little hotel with friendly english speaking staff. gare de lyon is directly opposite the hotel. Takes a while to get used to the metro (they need to sign the all the stops better). They serve a typical french breakfast with breads and ham and cheese but also coco pops and cornflakes. The elevator is quite small and so are the rooms but we probably on spent 6 hours sleeping the rest sightseeing so it didn't bother us much. You get more than what you pay for here. Rooms are always clean and no problem with staff and they have this kind of family run environment and not 100 staff all running about the place. There is a 24 bar/café on on the ground floor and we always stopped in for a drink on our way home. There is an italian around the corner and it is amazing. Out the door go left, take first left. at crossroads go to right and you'll see and yellow sign saying pizza. it's 4 away from the HBSC bank machine. Amazing little place. Get the linguine sea food dish. Delicious. Also when arriving get the train to chalet NOT the bus. It's €14 per person while the train and metro is only €1.50. Quite a saving. We got caught out as they told us at information to get bus and not the train. Hotel is a 4.5 out of 5. The only thing is breakfast and this is me being picky. (I like a big fry in the mornings when i'm on holiday!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jtaylor379
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location - great to be next to Gare de Lyon to get around Paris and see the sights. The rooms are decent - nothing fancy, but bright and welcoming. Very comfortable beds, nice breakfast, and even a small balcony out our room! The staff was very helpful, albeit with a bit of Paris "attitude." I have never seen a bathroom so clean in my entire life. The free wi-fi didn't work for about half of our stay which was frustrating. I booked this hotel after seeing it had the highest % of positive reviews, with the most stays - at venere.com. It deserves it - a fabulous value in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: swiftfrank
Reviews.Content: Came to Paris for Rugby World Cup and needed hotel with RER access to Stade De France and then on to south of France via Gare de Lyon. This hotel was perfect for us, quiet, very friendly and English speaking staff, clean, great breakfast. What more could we hope for ? The bistro next door had no smoking area and good inexpensive food. Great weekend ( shame about the rugby)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hyperplanners
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average by low-end European standards -- small facilities and rooms, but clean bathrooms. The location cannot be beat -- directly across the street from the Gare de Lyon train station (with great views from many rooms of the impressive station), with immediate access to the Metro, RER, intercity trains, and airport transportation.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient next to Gare du Lyon”
Reviews.Author: atraveller2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. Clean and comfortable, staff friendly etc.. Good value for money, no complaints. Right next to the train station which is on RER A (line which goes west - east) and RER D. One change onto RER B is necessary to get to/from CDG airport. Easy to reach all the sights. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Very near to the Seine river. We walked to Notre-Dame it took 20-30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: natrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late June 2007 in 3 rooms for 9 people. Room size was adequate. Rooms were very clean. Breakfast room was small but food was good - included in room price. Very convenient to Gare de Lyon which allowed quick access to main sites by Metro or bus. We were allowed to leave luggage for 24 hours while we did a quick overnight trip out of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Family Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ceadmile
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while passing through Paris just before Christmas on our way to Disneyland. We were travelling as a family with 2 kids aged 15 & 12. Picked this hotel because we only had one day in Paris (travelled from Dublin with Ryanair to Beauvais). I have to say that this was an excellent choice,not only for cost but also the position. We paid €132.00 for a quad room which we felt was good value. The room had 2 large double beds and a bathroom with double sinks. The room was clean and the bathroom was spotless. After an effecient check in we threw the bags in the room and planned to go sightseeing to make the most of our one day. Our room was facing the street but there was very little noise, even at night. The lady on reception was excellent, gave us maps and advised us how to get to certain sites the best way..we actually walked to Notre Dame from the hotel as it was quicker! Notre Dame was beautiful, candle-lit with xmas hymns being played. We also managed to climb the Eiffel Tower and go to the Louvre (free entry on Tuesday nights). We crammed a lot into a few hours but this was made possible because the Metro was so easy to manage. We bought the day pass (paris visite) and found this excellent value. We headed back to the hotel and ate in the little Italian next door which was reasonable. A 6am start the next day, and I was glad that I had booked this hotel as the RER station is just across the road. After an excellent breakfast all we had to do was head out and cross a very quiet (at this time of morning) street and we were on the train to Euro Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Langet
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near Gare de Lyon, some far from basic Paris's sights, but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: pltslp
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and wished I would have stayed longer. Its in a great location- right across from the Gare de Lyon where you can catch the TGV and metro. Very quiet, even though my room faced the station. The service was good, breakfast very nice. Smallest elevator I've ever seen. I couldn't figure out the tv, but no matter. The room and bath were very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: wheelman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for 4 nights , this time with a party of 12 including 6 young children. The staff on duty were excellent. They recognised myself and my wife from our previous stay and welcomed us back. They provided the children with sweets , colouring books and crayons to keep them amused , and gave us complimentary diaries when we were leaving. Despite the fact that we required a mixture of rooms family / double / smoking / nonsmoking we were on the same floor and adjacent to each other. We were accross the road from rer line a which took us straight to disneyland. There is a chain of hotels (can't remember which one) which claims that you stay AT other hotels but stay WITH us. This is what it feels like when you stay with this hotel. We will be back again.

HotelInfo.Name: Logis Terminus Lyon
HotelInfo.Address: 19 boulevard Diderot, 75012 Paris, France
